channel.title: South American on ZooBerry
channel.description: Recent content in South American on ZooBerry

item.title: South America Pack Part 2
item.description: Additional items for the South America theme, including a Tinamou and Incan objects.

item.title: Pampas Fox
item.description: A South American fox species for your zoo.

item.title: Andean Flamingo
item.description: A flamingo species with a highland salt lake biome and new sound.

item.title: Andean Flamingo (ES Version)
item.description: Includes 100% Endangered Species design with new features for the Andean Flamingo.

item.title: Rhea
item.description: A large, flightless bird of South America with new skin, sound, and enrichment.

item.title: Golden Dart Frog
item.description: The Golden Dart Frog is a bright yellow tropical amphibian, native to rainforests.

item.title: Three-Toed Sloth
item.description: Three-Toed Sloth is an animal for Zoo Tycoon 2 created by Hendrix and Unicorn.

item.title: Giant Anteater II
item.description: A giant anteater by Hendrix and German13.

item.title: Emperor Tamarin
item.description: The Emperor Tamarin (Saguinus imperator) is a tamarin allegedly named for its resemblance to the German emperor Wilhelm II.

item.title: Desert Pack
item.description: This is part of a set of eight biome packs that were made by the Zoo Admin Design Team many years ago.

item.title: Grassland Pack
item.description: This is part of a set of eight biome packs that were made by the Zoo Admin Design Team many years ago.

item.title: Maned Wolf
item.description: A South American savannah-dwelling canid with one variant skin.

item.title: Red-Footed Tortoise
item.description: Also known as the South American red-footed tortoise, the males grow up to 13.5 inches (30.4 cm) and are somewhat larger than females.

item.title: South America Pack
item.description: From the high Andes Mountains to the lush tropical Amazon Forest lives an amazing array of wildlife. Welcome to South America!

item.title: Vicuña Pack
item.description: Vicuñas are found in semiarid rolling grasslands and plains at altitudes of 3,500-5,750 meters.

item.title: Yellow-Knobbed Curassow
item.description: The yellow-knobbed curassow is a large terrestrial bird that eats fruit.

item.title: Giant Anteater
item.description: The giant anteater, Myrmecophaga tridactyla, is the largest species of anteater.

item.title: Blue Poison Dart Frog
item.description: These little frogs are easily recognized by their blue color, which is generally darker on the limbs and belly and overlaid with black spots or patches.

item.title: Chacoan Peccary
item.description: The Chacoan peccary’s bristly coat is a speckled charcoal or brownish-grey, interspersed with long guard hairs.

item.title: Yacare Caiman
item.description: The yacare caiman is found in a variety of habitat types, often associated with floating mats of vegetation.

item.title: Puma/Cougar
item.description: A large American cat that goes by many other names.

item.title: Nutria
item.description: A large rodent!
